metadata.title: CVE-2023-4050 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In some cases, an untrusted input stream was copied to a stack bufferwithout checking its size. This resulted in a potentially exploitable crashwhich could have led to a sandbox escape. This vulnerability affectsFirefox < 116, Firefox ESR < 102.14, and Firefox ESR < 115.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4050` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
mozjs78: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs91: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs102: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
